PDF Viewing, Bios, Timelines and More

After quantifying thousands of personal websites, we've identified the key features you need to present yourself clearly and succinctly.

Features like PDF viewing, skills tied to projects shown as pills below each description, and timelines to help readers understand your journey are just the tip of the iceberg.

Get Ahead Of The Curve

As online information becomes more and more important, personal websites and social resumes will become expected.

The bottom line is, it's a great idea to create an online presence now that you own and maintain yourself so you'll be ahead of the curve when everyone else is rushing to catch up with this trend.

Jacquelyn Smith

Forbes

If you're trying to land a new job this year, a personal website could be your secret weapon.

It's one of the best ways to take a personal brand to the next level. Employers want to get to know candidates and not only make sure they take pride in their craft, but also want to see if it's a cultural fit.

Nick Macario

Business Insider

To compete for your dream job, you have to not only meet the desired qualifications but also distinctly stand out from other applicants. A personal website, or portfolio website, can be a game changing tool to add dimension and "proof of expertise" for certain professions.

Robin Reshwan

US News
